alert.note: Alert for Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Piscataquis, west central Aroostook and Somerset Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Clayton Lake to 12 miles south of Billy-Jack Depot. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton Lake, Caucomgomoc Lake, Baker Lake, Chamberlain Lake, Tamway, Churchill Dam and Chesuncook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook
